children.title: Official Links

content.text: Help your members find your stuff. Customize the callouts below with your links. Add a callout by typing
. Highlight text to bring up the action bar and select the link icon to add a link.

This page was built using project info from our friends at Anomura! Anomura is a web3 gaming project with a greater purpose.  They will support wildlife conservation with their innovative play-to-donate model.

children.contentText: Help your members find your stuff. Customize the callouts below with your links. Add a callout by typing /callout. Highlight text to bring up the action bar and select the link icon to add a link.OpenSea: Anomura CollectionOpenSea: Mystery Bowl CollectionJoin our DiscordFollow us on TwitterPeep our roadmapVisit our DeepSea Challenger!Check out our Medium blogFollow us on InstagramVisit our websiteThank you, Anomura! This page was built using project info from our friends at Anomura! Anomura is a web3 gaming project with a greater purpose.  They will support wildlife conservation with their innovative play-to-donate model. Check it out!

children.contentText: Good Deals on OpenSea...Show off your collection. Embed OpenSea NFTs by clicking on the prompts below or typing /openseaYou can build an analytics dashboard for your collection using Dune and embed the charts and tables in CharmVerse by typing /dune. Using Dune does require some technical chops. If you don't have the chops, ask a friend   Collection Holders

children.title: Get Involved

content.text: Engage your members! Embed forms to collect information using the
command. You can select from a Google Form, Airtable, or Typeform.
Get input from your members! Insert a poll by typing
Let us know what you think
Learn how to create a proposal
A new proposal starts off in the "Private Draft" stage. Only authors and workspace admins can view/edit the proposal. Choose to move the proposal to "Public Draft" or directly to "Discussion"
All members have view only access to the proposal. Author(s) may continue to edit the proposal in the open and choose to move the proposal back to "Private Draft" or ahead to "Discussion"

Community members are invited to comment, suggest edits, and add polls to the proposal draft. If discussion leads to substantial editing, an author may decide to send the proposal back to either "Public Draft" or "Private Draft". When everything looks good,¬† an author may move the proposal forward to "In Review"

Designated reviewer(s) are invited to assess the proposal and move the proposal ahead to "Reviewed" if they believe the proposal is ready for a vote or back to any previous stage for more discussion and/or editing.¬†

Authors are notified that the proposal has been approved by a reviewer. An author or admin may initiate a community vote by moving the proposal to "Vote Active" or if they aren't ready, they can send the proposal back to any previous stage.

The author may create a vote in CharmVerse or publish the proposal to Snapshot. Community members will be notified that it is time to vote. Once the vote has been initiated, the proposal may not be modified in any way.
When the deadline for the vote has passed, results will be saved on the Proposals page for all eternity.¬†

children.contentText: Engage your members! Embed forms to collect information using the / command. You can select from a Google Form, Airtable, or Typeform.Apply to be a contributor.Get input from your members! Insert a poll by typing /poll Let us know what you thinkLearn how to create a proposal Private Draft: A new proposal starts off in the "Private Draft" stage. Only authors and workspace admins can view/edit the proposal. Choose to move the proposal to "Public Draft" or directly to "Discussion"Public Draft: All members have view only access to the proposal. Author(s) may continue to edit the proposal in the open and choose to move the proposal back to "Private Draft" or ahead to "Discussion"Discussion: Community members are invited to comment, suggest edits, and add polls to the proposal draft. If discussion leads to substantial editing, an author may decide to send the proposal back to either "Public Draft" or "Private Draft". When everything looks good,¬† an author may move the proposal forward to "In Review"In Review: Designated reviewer(s) are invited to assess the proposal and move the proposal ahead to "Reviewed" if they believe the proposal is ready for a vote or back to any previous stage for more discussion and/or editing.¬†Reviewed: Authors are notified that the proposal has been approved by a reviewer. An author or admin may initiate a community vote by moving the proposal to "Vote Active" or if they aren't ready, they can send the proposal back to any previous stage.Vote Active: The author may create a vote in CharmVerse or publish the proposal to Snapshot. Community members will be notified that it is time to vote. Once the vote has been initiated, the proposal may not be modified in any way.Vote Closed: When the deadline for the vote has passed, results will be saved on the Proposals page for all eternity.¬†

content.text: You can restrict access to this page and subpages using role-based access control.
1. Create a role for exclusive access
2. Build an invite link and include role
You can choose to add a Private link or a Token Gate
